00003 /**
00004  * @file ntrxranging.h
00005  * @date 2009-07-07
00006  * @author Christian Bock
00007  * @c (C) 2009 Nanotron Technologies
00008  * @brief Ranging support functions.
00009  *
00010  * This file contains the definitions of the ranging support
00011  * and calculation of a ranging cycle with the nanoLOC chip.
00012  *
00013  * $Revision: 6844 $
00014  * $Date: 2009-08-13 09:06:26 +0200 (Do, 13 Aug 2009) $
00015  * $LastChangedBy: sra $
00016  * $LastChangedDate: 2009-08-13 09:06:26 +0200 (Do, 13 Aug 2009) $
00017  */
00018 
00019 #ifndef NTRXRANGING_H
00020 #define NTRXRANGING_H
00021 
00022 /**
00023  * @def RANGE_DEBUG
00024  * @brief Enables debugging mode.
00025  */
00026 //#define RANGE_DEBUG   1
00027 
00028 /**
00029  * @def DEBUG_P
00030  * @brief Debugging output using printf. Can be globally disabled with
00031  * @ref RANGE_DEBUG .
00032  */
00033 #include <stdio.h>
00034 #ifdef RANGE_DEBUG
00035 #   define DEBUG_P(args, ...) printf_P(PSTR(args), ##__VA_ARGS__)
00036 #else  /*RANGE_DEBUG*/
00037 #   define DEBUG_P(args, ...)
00038 #endif /*RANGE_DEBUG*/
00039 
00040 #include "ntrxtypes.h"
00041 
00042 /** @brief Structure for the ranging result.
00043  *
00044  * When a ranging cycle is finished a ranging result message will
00045  * be send to the upper layer. The message will have the following
00046  * format.
00047  */
00048 typedef struct
00049 {
00050     uint8_t error; /**< status value of the ranging cycle */
00051     double distance; /**< result of measurement */
00052     AddrT addr; /**< address of remote ranging station */
00053 } RangingMsgT;
00054 
00055 #define MSG_TYPE_DATA           0
00056 #define MSG_TYPE_RANGING        1
00057 
00058 /* timeout in ms */
00059 #define RANGING_TIMEOUT 250
00060 
00061 /**
00062  * @def RANGING_PROTOCOL_LEN
00063  * @brief Defines the length of the ranging protocol.
00064  */
00065 #define RANGING_PROTOCOL_LEN 1
00066 
00067 /**
00068  * @def RANGING_TYPE_3W_A
00069  * @brief Defines the ranging type.
00070  * This type of ranging consists of one request packet, and two answer packets
00071  * with following behavior: ==>, <==, <== (distance is local generated).
00072  * The station which requests the ranging, gets the distance as indication in
00073  * the registered callback function.
00074  */
00075 #define RANGING_TYPE_3W_A       0
00076 
00077 /**
00078  * @def RANGING_TYPE_3W_B
00079  * @brief Defines the ranging type.
00080  * This type of ranging consists of one request packet, and two answer packets
00081  * with following behavior: ==>, <==, ==> (distance is remote generated).
00082  * The station which receives the request gets the distance as indication in
00083  * the registered callback function.
00084  */
00085 #define RANGING_TYPE_3W_B       1
00086 
00087 /**
00088  * @def RANGING_TYPE_2W_PP
00089  * @brief Defines the ranging type.
00090  * This type of ranging consists of one request packet, and one answer packet
00091  * with following behavior: ==>, <== (distance is remote generated).
00092  * The station which receives the request gets the distance as indication in
00093  * the registered callback function.
00094  * Advantage: Only 2 packets generate a distance (low power consumption)
00095  * Disadvantage: The first ranging dont generate a distance. (delay)
00096  */
00097 #define RANGING_TYPE_2W_PP  2
00098 
00099 
00100 /**
00101  * @brief This function try to start a ranging process.
00102  * @param *msg this is the pointer to send message
00103  * @note This function is called ever on a PD_RANGING_REQUEST.
00104  * If transmitter is free, and no other ranging is running, this
00105  * function starts a new ranging process.
00106  *
00107  * RANGING_TYPE_3W_A = --->,<---,<--- (singel measurement, distance local known)
00108  * RANGING_TYPE_3W_B = --->,<---,---> (singel measurement, distance remote known)
00109  * RANGING_TYPE_2W_PP= --->,<--- (continue, distance remote known)
00110  *
00111  */
00112 void NTRXRangingRequest(MsgT *msg);
00113 
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * @brief This function initialize the local ranging memory.
00117  * @note This function must called once during initialisation to
00118  * ensure that the local ranging memory is in initial position.
00119  *
00120  */
00121 void NTRXRangingInit(void);
00122 
00123 
00124 /**
00125  * @brief This function collects data from a rx packet.
00126  * @param *msg this is the pointer to recieved message
00127  * @note This function is called on rx interrupt, after an ranging
00128  * packet is recieved. Depending on the RANGING_TYPE next steps will
00129  * proccessed.
00130  *
00131  */
00132 void NTRXRangingRX(MsgT *msg);
00133 
00134 
00135 /**
00136  * @brief This function collects data from a hardware acknowledge.
00137  * @param *msg this is the message pointer to the sended message
00138  * @note This function is called on hardware ack, after an ranging
00139  * packet is send. Depending on the RANGING_TYPE next steps will
00140  * proccessed.
00141  *
00142  */
00143 void NTRXRangingACK(void);
00144 
00145 
00146 /**
00147  * @brief This function is called on baseband timer interrupt (ranging timeouts)
00148  * @note baseband timer starts on every successfull ranging request and
00149  * if no answer is received the interrupt occure and ranging will abort.
00150  * This prevents blocking the phy for new remote ranging requests.
00151  */
00152 void NTRXRangingInterrupt(void);
00153 
00154 /**
00155  * @brief This function returns the internal status of ranging.
00156  * @note This function should be called before setting the driver
00157  * into power down, to ensure that ranging is finished.
00158  * @return TRUE if no ranging is pending, otherweise FALSE
00159  *
00160  */
00161 bool_t NTRXRangingIsIDLE(void);
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * @brief Function pointer type which the PHY uses to get permission for
00165  * automatic ranging measurements with the given MAC address.
00166  * @param macAddr MAC address of the remote ranging device.
00167  * @param payload user data
00168  * @param len length of data
00169  * @returns TRUE if ranging with the remote device will be permitted; FALSE
00170  * otherwise.
00171  * @see RangingRegisterCallback
00172  *
00173  * Implement a function with this interface above the PHY layer that decides
00174  * whether or not the PHY may perform ranging with the remote station. Register
00175  * your function to the PHY by calling @ref RangingRegisterCallback .
00176  */
00177 typedef bool_t (*permissionfn_t)(uint8_t *macAddr, uint8_t *data, uint8_t *len);
00178 
00179 
00180 
00181 /**
00182  * @brief Function pointer which the PHY uses to request memory for its
00183  * internal ranging states regarding the given remote MAC address.
00184  * @param memSize Size of memory which the PHY needs to perform ranging with
00185  * the given remote station.
00186  * @param macAddr MAC address of the remote ranging partner.
00187  * @returns Pointer to a piece of memory of the requested size that the PHY
00188  * may use. NULL if there is no memory available for the given remote station.
00189  * @see RangingRegisterCallback
00190  *
00191  * Implement a function with this interface above the PHY layer if you wish to
00192  * perform ping pong ranging. The PHY needs a seperate piece of memory to save
00193  * its internal ranging state for @em each remote station. The user is
00194  * responsible for the memory management. i.e. memory allocation and assignment
00195  * corresponding to the given MAC address. Register your function to the PHY
00196  * by calling @ref RangingRegisterCallback .
00197  */
00198 typedef void* (*mem_assignfn_t)(uint16_t memSize, uint8_t *macAddr);
00199 
00200 
00201 
00202 /**
00203  * @brief Registers function pointers to ranging specific functions.
00204  * @param rgPermission If set the PHY will ask the user by this function for
00205  * permission to perform ranging with a given remote MAC address. Default
00206  * on startup for this parameter is NULL, i.e. ranging will always be performed.
00207  * @param rgGetMemory If set the PHY will call this function in order to
00208  * obtain a valid piece of memory to store internal ranging states while
00209  * ranging with a certain remote station. Default for this parameter is NULL,
00210  * i.e. the PHY will be capable to perform ranging with @em only @em one
00211  * ranging partner.
00212  * @note Ping-Pong ranging will be rejected if @ref rgGetMemory is not assigned.
00213  */
00214 void RangingRegisterCallback(permissionfn_t rgPermission, mem_assignfn_t rgGetMemory);
00215 
00216 #endif /* NTRXRANGING_H */
